name: Massimiliano Albanese
content: Massimiliano Albanese | School of Computing Skip to content Massimiliano Albanese Titles and Organizations Associate Professor / Tenured; Associate Chair for Research; Associate Director, Center for Secure Information Systems Contact Information Campus: FairfaxBuilding: Research HallSuite 417Phone: 703-993-1629Email: malbanes@gmu.edu Personal Websites CSIS Max Albanese website In the News Massimiliano Albanese named executive director of Institute for Digital Innovation September 10, 2025 Max Albanese on security in America's electionsMay 2, 2024 New scoring framework addresses software vulnerabilitiesOctober 25, 2022 Pragmatics Pitch IT Provides Valuable Student ExperienceApril 15, 2015 Biography Massimiliano Albanese addresses practical challenges in information and network security. He serves as the Associate Director of the Center for Secure Information Systems at George Mason University. Albanese's research encompasses cyber attack detection, cyber situational awareness, and related fields. He holds three U.S. patents, has co-authored two books and over 80 publications, and has received numerous awards for his research and scholarly contributions. Research Cybersecurity Teaching Information Security Degrees PhD, Computer Science and Engineering, University of Naples Federico II, Italy MS, Computer Science and Engineering, University of Naples Federico II, Italy
